pageTitle: EVAL SDK Old 2011Q2 for DM365 Leopard Board - RidgeRun Developer Connection
title: Table 2. Differences between EVAL SDK and Professional SDK release 2011Q2
textBeforeTable: The EVAL SDK 2011Q2 is based on the Professional SDK 2011Q2 but it has been added some limitations. The main differences between both SDK versions are listed below: Differences between the EVAL SDK and Professional SDK 1 The library provided within the Evaluation SDK is a 100% functional demo version that allows you to test it. Auto exposure and auto white balance library 1 JFFS2 NAND support. NAND and SD boot support. SD recovery support Support for component, composite and DVI video output Application to handle video capture previewer and resizer New driver for the 5MP camera sensor MT9P031 (improved frame rate, works with GStreamer...) Audio support added Updated GStreamer DMAI plugins Updated DVSDK version to 4.02.00.06 Updated kernel version to 2.6.32.17 What's new? DM365 Introductory Information DM365 documentation Leopard Board Design Something site DM365 Leopard Board related documentation: SDK F.A.Q. RidgeRun 2011Q2 SDK User Guide General SDK documentation: Documentation Initial Version 1 06-17-2011 Comments Revision Date
textAfterTable: Supported Operating Systems Linux Distribution Ubuntu 9.04, 9.10, 10.04 and 10.10 in 32 bits. SDK Details This is an Evaluation Linux SDK build for Texas Instruments DM365 System on Chip and based on the Professional SDK 2011Q2. Hardware This SDK is designed to run on the DM365 LeopardBoard and DM368 LeopardBoard. 2 2 Since it is possible to use this evaluation version for the LeopardBoard DM368, it will not provide the maximun clock rates for this architecture. In order to get the maximun performance for this board please purchase our Professional SDK. Software This SDK includes: ARM toolchain: gcc 4.2.4. U-Boot 1.3.4 Linux kernel 2.6.32. DM365 support for the following drivers: Sensor MT9T031 for 5MP camera. Video output support: DVI, Component and Composite. UART. MTD (NAND flash). V4L2. Watchdog timer. Real time clock. USB (host and gadget). VPBE Framebuffer. Ethernet. I2C. SPI. MMC/SD. IPIPE. JFFS2 Auto white balance and auto exposure library. Integration with TI's digital video toolkit for DaVinci platforms - DVSDK 4.00.02.06. Please make sure to download and install the DVSDK before building the RidgeRun SDK. Install the DVSDK by running dvsdk_3_10_00_19_Setup.bin. Be sure to use the default installation values. dvsdk_3_10_00_19_Setup.bin can be downloaded from TI's site.
